intro: Cyclogramma khasiensis, commonly known as the Khasi cyclogramma, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky terrains. Its botanical features include compound leaves and pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or water. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
